steps.description: User arrives from a comparison site (e.g., CompareTheMarket) and is redirected to Direct Line landing page with prefilled vehicle and postcode parameters. UTM and referral data captured for attribution.
steps.businessRationale: Short redirect and landing load must be fast to avoid bounce; each second of delay reduces quote starts and therefore potential premium revenue.

steps.description: Customer enters vehicle, driver, and address details or confirms prefilled data; account creation or guest flow; identity checks (basic) and eligibility checks initiated.
steps.businessRationale: Data entry is the primary friction point; realistic time accounts for form completion and identity checks. Faster completion increases quote throughput and conversion to bind.

steps.description: Real-time rating engine calculates premiums using underwriting rules, telematics/third-party data lookups (vehicle history, claims), and displays price options (Comprehensive, Third Party Fire & Theft).
steps.businessRationale: Quote engine must respond within seconds; slow or failed pricing directly reduces conversion and increases abandonment. This step produces the 'price shown' business event tied to potential revenue.

steps.description: Customer selects product SKU (e.g., Car-Comprehensive, Car-ThirdParty) and optional add-ons (LegalCover, BreakdownCover, ExcessProtection); endorsements and cover limits adjusted; final premium recalculated.
steps.businessRationale: Upsell and cross-sell opportunities occur here; average order value increases with add-ons. Time reflects decision and recalculation latency which must be low to avoid drop-off.

steps.description: Customer enters payment details or uses saved payment method; payment gateway authorization; policy issuance transaction to Policy Administration System (PAS); confirmation and invoice generated.
steps.businessRationale: Payment success is the critical revenue event. Failures or latency here cause immediate lost revenue. Policy bind must be atomic to avoid charging without issuance.

steps.description: Generate policy documents, e-policy PDF, and welcome email/SMS; store policy in customer portal; trigger post-purchase cross-sell and onboarding workflows.
steps.businessRationale: Timely document delivery reduces support contacts and increases trust; document delivery event closes the purchase funnel and enables retention and cross-sell tracking.
